item.title: ‚úçÔ∏è Prescriptions
item.description:
If one needs a prescription for a medicine in Poland, the fastest way would be one of these special services. Prices vary, but one could expect them to be 50‚Äì100 PLN. There are no guarantees, as well, but in case of a refusal refunds are available.

  • Receptozaur (cheaper, full refunds)

  • Receptomat (pricier, with 10 PLN non-refundable fee)

  • MEDICEPT

item.title: ‚¨õ Code of Practice
item.description:
1. Wear the uniform

  2. Think long term (like 30 years from now)

  3. Build stories and languages, not things

  4. Create your own universe (or join ours)

  5. Collect samples

  6. Be a sample for somebody else

  7. Look for loyalty, not for a skill set

  8. Do not build utilitarian products. However, use them as a medium to express yourself

  9. Do not exploit introverts ‚Äî doesn‚Äôt work long term. Learn to be an introvert yourself

  10. Travel more

  11. Do not work for corporations. Old corporations were meaningful when their founders were alive, but now, they have outlived their relevancy. They exist only to keep their numbers growing

  12. New corporations are no better. They have scaled up features, and today‚Äôs founders want hyper-growth for growth‚Äôs sake (it seems like every line of code, every feature deserves its own corporation ‚Äî it sure doesn‚Äôt)

  13. So, fuck the corporations

  14. Tell the truth (bullshit never works long term)

  15. Study and research fashion

  16. Your phone is a temporary feature ‚Äî don‚Äôt spend your life on it (like you wouldn‚Äôt spend it on a fax machine)

  17. Fuck likes, followers, fake lives, fake friends

  18. Remake your environment. Build it for yourself, and people will come

  19. Only trust those who make things you love

  20. Move to LA

  21. Don‚Äôt buy property

  22. Don‚Äôt go to Mars (just yet)

  23. Use only one font, just a few colors, and just a few shapes

  24. Use spreadsheets, but only to map out the next 30 years ‚Äî one cell for each year

  25. The next three are the most important

  26. The past doesn‚Äôt exist ‚Äî don‚Äôt get stuck in it

  27. Don‚Äôt go to Silicon Valley (it‚Äôs not for you if you‚Äôre still reading this)

  28. Remind yourself daily: you and everyone you know will die

  29. We must build the most beautiful things

  30. We are 2046 kids

item.title: üçÄ Luck
item.description:
• Is Success Luck or Hard Work?

    Even with luck accounting for just 5% of the outcome, nine or maybe ten of the eleven applicants selected would have been different if luck played no role at all.

    ‚Äî Veritasium
    On importance of luck

  • How to Create Luck

    • You can actively create optimal conditions for lucky things to happen to you.

    • Luck is not binary

    • Luck surface area

    • Four Kinds of Luck

      • Hope luck finds you.

      • Hustle until you stumble into it.

      • Prepare the mind and be sensitive to chances others miss.

      • Become the best at what you do. Refine what you do until this is true. Opportunity will seek you out. Luck becomes your destiny.

item.title: üë¥üèΩ PPK
item.description:
Glossary

PPK

Pracownicze Plany Kapita≈Çowe, employee capital plans.

IKE

Indywidualne Konto Emerytalne.

TFI

Towarzystwa Funduszy Inwestycyjnych, investment fund company.

PTE

Powszechne Towarzystwo Emerytalne, universal pension company.

PrTE

Pracownicze Towarzystwo Emerytalne, employee pension company.

PPE

Pracowniczy Program Emerytalny, employee pension plan.

General Information

PPK is a universal savings system for employees. The main objective of PPK is to provide the participant with additional money, which can be used after the age of 60, and in exceptional situations earlier.

item.title: üì± Apps
item.description:
Apps

  • iBrewCoffee

    Personal coffee tasting journal. Probably, the most comprehensive one. It has everything: beans, roasters, grinders, methods, ratings, etc. Event kettles!

  • Aeromatic

    The AeroPress timer app with 50+ recipes.

  • 2 Brew

    PWA coffee timer with predefined recipes for AeroPress, V60 and Moka pot.

  • coffee.cup.guru

    Android app with filtered coffee recipes and coffee log.

item.title: üî∫ CAP
item.description:
Misc

  • You Can‚Äôt Sacrifice Partition Tolerance [EN üá∫üá∏] [Oct 2010]

    Of the CAP theorem‚Äôs Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance, Partition Tolerance is mandatory in distributed systems. You cannot not choose it. Instead of CAP, you should think about your availability in terms of yield (~availability, percent of requests answered successfully) and harvest (~consistency, percent of required data actually included in the responses) and which of these two your system will sacrifice when failures happen.

item.title: üôà Touch typing
item.description:
Learning

  • keybr.com |

    My "the touch typing trainer". Super-comfy minimalistic interface, I absolutely love it. Comprehensive statistics included.

  • TypingClub

    Wide selection of programs to learn with comfortable excercises interface. Just good.

  • Ratatype |

    Pretty intense excerises, with almost no error tolerance.

  • Typing.com

    Just ok. There is a straightforward learning path here.

  • typing.io

    Typing real code from OSS projects.

  • TypingAcademy

  • Touch Typing Study

Flexing

  • MonkeyType |

  • Nitro Type

  • Key Hero

  • TypingTest.com

  • 10FastFingers

item.title: üóúÔ∏è AeroPress
item.description:
Recipes

  • AeroPrecipe

    AeroPress recipes.

Theory

  • The AeroPress Series by James Hoffmann. [üá¨üáß]

    • AeroPress was invented in 2005 by Alan Adler, inventor and retired Stanford University engineering instructor.

    • Brew for about 2 minutes (depends on the grinding).

    • Stir (or swirl).

    • Doubling the amount of coffee for dilution and making two cups doesn‚Äôt work.

    • Inverted method has no benefits.

    • Don‚Äôt press to hard.

    • Preheating doesn‚Äôt make any sense.

    • Brew at 80 ¬∞C or 100 ¬∞C.

    • Rinsing the filter doesn‚Äôt make any difference.

    • Double up the coffee dose and brew twice longer to make two cups.
